page.title: 14The Pig Farm Landscove
page.content: This is situated at Beara Farm and covers an area of 5.5 acres.There are three main 'houses' and a smaller house for pregnant sows and new litters. The amount of light and heat is carefully controlled and the feed is in the form of a liquified 'porridge' specially formulated by the {farmer}for maximum growth.Most of the {pigs}go for slaughter at about six months ,to the Harris{Bacon}Factory in Totnes,but a few go to local people and butchers for{pork}Mr.and Mrs.Hext and their two sons run the farm and appeared on a television programme to explain their work.Some parents buy half a pig for about Â£30 to store in their freezers and enjoy the excellent quality meat over a period of six months or so.
